milestone.description:
Mobile dev team priorities In priority order:

**1. Finish anything that wasn't completed in the previous 1.25 cycle**

**2. Select which accounts to share with each Community's control node**
- Designs should be ready for review and dev feedback by 18th September

**3. Fix bugs, both functional and UX fit-and-finish defects.**  

- Great progress during 1.25 on fixing UX fit-and-finish defects :-)  Let's aim to close all issue tagged "E:Design Feedback 1.24" by the end of this cycle.

- Test all Communities functionality using the Public Test Community that will feature all types of token gating that Iuri is going to set up.  

- Test how Status Mobile responds to community admin changes are made in Status Desktop e.g. when a channel is added or deleted or renamed, is the correctly reflected in Status Mobile?  Are changes to Community meta info like name and banner image correctly reflected in Status Mobile?  Etc, etc...

- We need to get our quality bar to where we want it to be, and then keep tech. debt at a roughly fixed level as we build out any additional functionality.

- Going forward, as much as is sensible, all new functionality should meet the higher quality bar we are aiming for before landing.

**4. Fix any remaining issues related to syncing with Desktop**

**5. Implement the OOBE light/dark theme selector screen**
- Only if the design for this is ready in time, otherwise it's ok if this happens next cycle

**--- Things that should NOT be worked on this cycle ---**

- We shouldn't start anything in Settings or Profile related


------------------------

**Mobile Wallet dev team priority:**

- Continue building out Mobile wallet MVP

body:
This issue refers to  [#16801](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/pull/16801)

## Problem
During the implementation of the account-card component, the team noticed that the dashed border is not the same as Figma. For reference please check the Review 3 here:

https://www.figma.com/file/Tf5nfkYvpbnNCo4rKLK7lS/Feedback-for-Mobile?type=design&node-id=3356-276830&mode=design&t=4HgK5AwVqRGvZyxG-0

The goal of this issue is to achieve a custom SVG border that match exactly the design provided

#### Expected behavior
The design should follow Figma. In the case of the card account component, the dashed border is applied to the type "Add-Account". Here's the Figma file:
https://www.figma.com/file/WQZcp6S0EnzxdTL4taoKDv/Design-System-for-Mobile?type=design&node-id=19513-197699&mode=design&t=AyTZe7l184ev1VcK-0


#### Actual behavior
React Native does not allow us to customize the dashed border as we need (e.g. space in between each dash), it's limited to :border-width and :border-color in that case.


### Reproduction

1. Please navigate to "Profile and Quo.2.0 Preview" and locate the component under "Wallet/account-card."

### Additional Information

- Operating System: Android, iOS

Also, during the implementation of the account_card we came to this piece of code which can be used as an example to achieve what we need:

```

(defn- add-account-view
  [{:keys [on-press customization-color theme metrics?]}]
  [rn/view {:style {:flex 1 :justify-content "center" :align-items "center"}}
    [:> svg/Svg
      {:height (if metrics? 88 68)
       :width  161}
      [:> svg/Path
        {:d (if metrics? 
              "M16,0 h129 a16,16 0 0 1 16,16 v56 a16,16 0 0 1 -16,16 h-129 a16,16 0 0 1 -16,-16 v-56 a16,16 0 0 1 16,-16"
              "M16,0 h129 a16,16 0 0 1 16,16 v36 a16,16 0 0 1 -16,16 h-129 a16,16 0 0 1 -16,-16 v-36 a16,16 0 0 1 16,-16")
         :stroke (colors/theme-colors "pink" colors/white-opa-5 theme)
         :strokeWidth "1"
         :fill "none"
         :strokeDasharray "4"}]]
    [rn/view {:style {:position "absolute" :height (if metrics? 88 68) :justify-content "center" :align-items "center"}}
      [button/button
        {:type               :primary
         :size               24
         :icon               true
         :accessibility-label :add-account
         :on-press           on-press
         :customization-color customization-color}
        :i/add]]])

```
